intro: Ecbolium salviifolium, commonly known as the blue sage, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, gray-green leaves and clusters of striking blue to violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its unique coloration and drought tolerance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
